alert.note: Alert for Karnes; Wilson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 7:58AM CDT until May 15 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... San Antonio River near Floresville affecting Wilson and Karnes Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...San Antonio River near Floresville. * WHEN...From this evening to late tomorrow morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 19.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to flood stage late this evening. It will then fall to 14.3 feet early Tuesday afternoon. It will rise to 16.2 feet late Wednesday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 28.0 feet on 07/08/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed San Antonio River Floresville 27.0 19.1 Sun 7 am CDT 23.0 14.4 16.2 &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 800 PM CDT.
